direction: Use CatBoost with the following settings: iterations=600, learning_rate=0.026, depth=8. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median and drop columns with more than 50% missing values. Do not use get_dummies for categorical columns; instead, pass the cat_features parameter to CatBoost. If you encounter a dtype error, cast categorical features to strings before passing them to the model.
executor_guidance: Ensure that you handle NaN values appropriately and avoid using get_dummies for categorical columns. Instead, use the cat_features parameter in CatBoost to handle categorical data. If you encounter any dtype issues, convert categorical columns to strings.
